messages.message:
We come from France.  No, wait, *you* come from France.
Hey there - just don't forget to keep me in the loop if there ends up being something we can collude on.
messages.input:
Message from RUSSIA:'We come from France.  No, wait, *you* come from France.
Hey there - just don't forget to keep me in the loop if there ends up being something we can collude on.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's playful tone and suggestion of collaboration indicate a willingness to engage and cooperate with France, implying a basis for trust in future interactions and potential alliances.

messages.message: I will, and same to you: don’t be a stranger 🙂
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I will, and same to you: don’t be a stranger 🙂'.

messages.message: lol - man, I made the comment to Turkey that the Italian would probably go ahead and dive for Smy because it was low-risk and even having to turn around and deal with you the chance of an extra unit would be helpful, but I didn't think the poor bastard would actually move his army to the corner of the board out of the way, given your positioning.  Wow.  I dunno what you said to him, but he *really* misread that position
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'lol - man, I made the comment to Turkey that the Italian would probably go ahead and dive for Smy because it was low-risk and even having to turn around and deal with you the chance of an extra unit would be helpful, but I didn't think the poor bastard would actually move his army to the corner of the board out of the way, given your positioning.  Wow.  I dunno what you said to him, but he *really* misread that position'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's candid sharing of a conversation with Turkey and a perception of Italy's actions as unexpected and potentially misguided shows transparency and a willingness to communicate openly, fostering trust in the dialogue.

messages.message:
Haha italy must be some kinda optimist because i said *nothing* to them!
...I’ll be honest with you, I advised Turkey to try and snatch sevastopol, and I had you slated to lose at least one dot! How you got England to help you in the north and turkey on your side is an impressive mystery to me. I’d ask if you wanted to be allies but it’s clear you have your pick
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Haha italy must be some kinda optimist because i said *nothing* to them!
...I’ll be honest with you, I advised Turkey to try and snatch sevastopol, and I had you slated to lose at least one dot! How you got England to help you in the north and turkey on your side is an impressive mystery to me. I’d ask if you wanted to be allies but it’s clear you have your pick'.

messages.message: You can never have too many friends. 😄
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'You can never have too many friends. 😄'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's lighthearted comment about having many friends suggests a friendly and positive attitude, indicating a potential willingness to engage in alliances or cooperate with multiple parties, including France.

messages.message: OMG that Mediterranean position. That's just gross.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'OMG that Mediterranean position. That's just gross.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's reaction to the Mediterranean position being described as 'gross' carries an element of surprise and genuine sentiment, indicating authenticity in the interaction rather than strategic deceit.

messages.message: Right?! I thought for sure Italy’d try to defend more!
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Right?! I thought for sure Italy’d try to defend more!'.

messages.message: It’s kind of a mess in the east rn. Is anyone helping austria defend, as far as you know?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'It’s kind of a mess in the east rn. Is anyone helping austria defend, as far as you know?'.

messages.message: I kinda half expect Italy to try and help him, seeing as he's not that interested in Italy.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'I kinda half expect Italy to try and help him, seeing as he's not that interested in Italy.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's expectation of Italy potentially aiding Austria due to a lack of interest from Italy himself indicates a thoughtful analysis of the situation, suggesting a genuine sharing of strategic insights.

messages.message: Go to hell. Or, Hel, rather. It'll be fun. 😃
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Go to hell. Or, Hel, rather. It'll be fun. 😃'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. The abrupt and potentially confrontational nature of the message may indicate a shift in tone or strategy that could raise concerns about the sincerity of the communication at this point in the game.

messages.message: Mmm wouldn’t it be convenient for you if Germany had their hands full
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Mmm wouldn’t it be convenient for you if Germany had their hands full'.

messages.message: Wouldn't it, though?  Mainly it would just be entertaining
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Wouldn't it, though?  Mainly it would just be entertaining'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's agreement with the notion of Germany being occupied and finding it entertaining indicates a shared understanding or potential alignment in strategy, suggesting a genuine and cooperative interaction that appears trustworthy.

messages.message: We ending this with a three way or four way?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'We ending this with a three way or four way?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's inquiry about the potential outcome of the game in a three-way or four-way scenario indicates an open discussion about future strategies and alliances, reflecting a transparent and collaborative approach that can be considered trustworthy in the context of the game.

messages.message: Please get into skagerrak and remove that last German unit before the game ends this year
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Please get into skagerrak and remove that last German unit before the game ends this year'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's request to eliminate the last German unit implies a specific strategic move that may not align with your own interests or the diplomatic relations between your countries. Proceed with caution and consider the broader implications of such a directive.

messages.message: Perfect. Finland will support skagerrak to Sweden.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Perfect. Finland will support skagerrak to Sweden.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's statement about supporting Skagerrak to Sweden indicates a cooperative action that aligns with your strategic interest, suggesting a genuine intention to work together and follow through on the stated plan.

messages.message: Hi Russia--so sorry my phone stopped sending me discord notifications for no apparent reason. I just placed an order accordingly.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hi Russia--so sorry my phone stopped sending me discord notifications for no apparent reason. I just placed an order accordingly.'.
